instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2879: What is 820-2879? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.CHGR_ACOK: What is CHGR_ACOK? This is identical to SMC_BC_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.ADAPTER_SENSE: What is ADAPTER_SENSE? This is a line between the onewire circuit and the magsafe charger where the magsafe charger can talk to the SMC(system management controller) on the SYS_ONEWIRE line..
definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: Another <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No green No orange Wont turn on
threads.message:
Has substancial liquid damage. Have [FONT=Courier][SIZE=14px]<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>,[/SIZE][/FONT][FONT=Courier][SIZE=14px]<SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL>(3.23v)
When I check the power on pads i get 2.4v for <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL>.
Not sure what is pulling that low. I do not have an ultrasonic to clean the board.
Any thoughts? I have checked the <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> and have 4v on ac in, I have pin 14 <SIGNAL>CHGR_ACOK</SIGNAL>, I have 3.4v on <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> [/SIZE][/FONT]
[FONT=Courier] [/FONT]

threads.title: Another <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No green No orange Wont turn on
threads.message:
That 2.4V is causing the SMC to be in bypass mode so no green light. Check what is pulling that down, probably corrosion in KBD connector.
Also measure resistance to GND on 3V42 bus and on the RTC Xtal, many times the MCP will be dead too.

threads.title: Another <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No green No orange Wont turn on
threads.message:
Ok, I cleaned some minor corrosion on the KBD connector and I know have 3.4v on power pads, but still can not get green or orange light(brilliant by the way Duke)

So, now how would I proceed? It was just a small amount of corrosion by the way.

threads.title: Another <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No green No orange Wont turn on
Another <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No green No orange Wont turn on
threads.message: I asked more things! Also check if what the voltage is on <SIGNAL>ADAPTER_SENSE</SIGNAL> and F7040.

threads.title: Another <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No green No orange Wont turn on
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>ADAPTER_SENSE</SIGNAL> 16.5v
F7040 12.57v but it appears to get voltage then drop, then get it again
i check diode measurement for [FONT=Courier][SIZE=14px]<SIGNAL>RTC_CLK32K_XTALIN</SIGNAL> it is .810, not sure if that is correct. I am not sure what [/SIZE][/FONT][FONT=Courier][SIZE=14px]point exactly was the "[/SIZE][/FONT]RTC Xtal" also not sure what point you mean by " 3V42 bus"

threads.title: Another <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No green No orange Wont turn on
threads.message:
You have main voltage on the SENSE line that is why there is no green light. Bad magsafe board or corrosion under connector.
3V42 bus is <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>, measure resistance to GND plz.

threads.title: Another <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No green No orange Wont turn on
threads.message:
[SIZE=14px]<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> in diode mode with no adapter plugged in is .28v, new magsafe board and have green light. Checked a 2012 13" model <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> it had .32v on [/SIZE]<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>
Not sure how close they have to be

threads.title: Another <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No green No orange Wont turn on
threads.message: he said resistance, not diode mode

threads.title: Another <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No green No orange Wont turn on
threads.message: If i am understanding correctly(no guarantees) I measure [SIZE=14px]<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> at 3.2k ohms  on pin 5 of <CHIP>U6901</CHIP>[/SIZE]

threads.title: Another <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No green No orange Wont turn on
threads.message: 3K tells me the MCP is most likely dead, it should be over 25K in a good board. Do you really want to continue this board into the hell hole?

threads.title: Another <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No green No orange Wont turn on
threads.message:
Sounds like a parts board to me. Just curious, would that be a similar repair to the smc?
Can not seem to get a win on these.

threads.title: Another <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No green No orange Wont turn on
threads.message: It the same as any BGA repair. Getting a good MCP89MZ is even more of a gamble than finding good SMC chips.

threads.title: Another <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No green No orange Wont turn on
threads.message: Ok, thanks again for your patience with us.
